function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Using measures that capture the intensity of pandemic events instead of a binary variable for pandemic events","Impact":"Issues related to accuracy and comparability of data","Mitigation":"Ensure consistency and reliability of data sources, consider multiple metrics for validation","Technologies":"Data analytics and validation tools","People":"Researchers, statisticians, public health officials","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Inclusion of a recession dummy to control for business cycles","Impact":"Influence of recession periods on pandemic events and robot adoption","Mitigation":"Consider additional economic indicators, conduct sensitivity analysis","Technologies":"Economic modeling and forecasting tools","People":"Economists, data analysts, policy makers","Owner":"Economic research institutions, government agencies"},{"Description":"Use of log of robot adoption variable to mitigate issues related to the long tail in the distribution of the robotics data","Impact":"Data distribution skewness may affect results and interpretations","Mitigation":"Explore alternative data transformations, conduct robustness checks","Technologies":"Data transformation and normalization methods","People":"Data scientists, statisticians, researchers","Owner":"Data analysis teams"}]}
